No potion particles will be disabled
particle_core.particle_core_config.OTHER: Potion particles emitted by other players (not you) will be disabled
Potion particles emitted by you will be disabled
Potion particles emitted by non-player mobs will be disabled
particle_core.particle_core_config.ALL.d: All potion particles will be disabled
particle_core.particle_core_config.NO_CU: Disables particle culling completely. Not recommended unless required.
particle_core.particle_core_config.AGGRE: Culls particles using their mid point. Best performance but does technically cull particles that happen to be just in-frame (but less than halfway). This is rarely noticeable, but if it is for you use Bounding Box
particle_core.particle_core_config.BOUND: Culls particles using the edges of their bounding box. Good performance gain and mitigates particles clipping out from the edge of the screen.
particle_core.particle_core_config.disab:
§cImpact: HIGH§r

[true or false] Completely turns off all particles on the client.
particle_core.particle_core_config.byTyp:
§6Impact: Medium§r

Allows reduction/disabling of individual particle types. Ex. setting 'minecraft:smoke' to 0.3 will cause Smoke and Campfire particles to spawn at 30% of their normal rate.
particle_core.particle_core_config.maxPa:
§6Impact: Medium§r

[Value between 0 and ~2 Billion] Sets how many particles can be spawned at a time. Default is 16,384.
particle_core.particle_core_config.parti:
§6Impact: Medium§r

[Value between 0.1 and 1.0] Multiplier for how far away particles should render, based on block render distance. Default is 1 (full render distance).

Example: At 0.5, particles will only render 6 chunks away with 12 render distance.
particle_core.particle_core_config.async:
§6Impact: Medium§r

[true or false] When true (default), particles will tick asynchronously (not on the clients main loop). This may cause instabilities.

Particle Core will try to automatically disable this if instabilities occur. If it can't, disable this manually

When particle count is low, Particle Core will tick synchronously regardless of this setting to avoid wasting time with async overhead.
particle_core.particle_core_config.culli:
§3Impact: Non-Performance§r

Particles that should be ignored by culling. This will prevent issues with particles that might behave strangely with culling, especially aggressive culling.

In particular, very large particles benefit from being blacklisted if you are using aggressive culling.

§cImpact: HIGH§r

How particles are culled by Particle Core. Disabling this will have a large performance impact.
particle_core.particle_core_config.reduc:
§aImpact: Low§r

[Value between 0.0 and 1.0] Turns down particles when in ALL mode. Ex. 0.1 will make 10% of particles DECREASED. Basically a dial between ALL and DECREASED.

§aImpact: Low§r

[Value between 0.0 and 1.0] Turns down particles when in DECREASED mode. Ex. 0.1 will make 10% of particles MINIMAL. Basically a dial between DECREASED and MINIMAL.
particle_core.particle_core_config.turnO:
§aImpact: Low§r

Disables potion particles by various degrees, depending on the selection.
